alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 12:25PM EDT until July 18 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting City of Richmond, Chesterfield and Henrico Counties. James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Richmond Locks. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The Ancarrow`s Boat Landing is closed at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:54 AM EDT Sunday the stage was -0.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise tonight then will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 8.7 feet late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.7 feet on 04/18/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EDT.
